result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary E Jackson-Towers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mary E Jackson-Towers appeared by video.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for Mary E Jackson-Towers.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests in person plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court authorizes defendant to have supervised visitation with the child if it is ordered by the CHIPS case and DMCPS. Defendant is not to discuss the case with the child.

Defendant Mary E Jackson-Towers in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court authorizes defendant to have supervised visitation with the child if it is ordered by the CHIPS case and DMCPS. Defendant is not to discuss the case with the child. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Mary E Jackson- Towers in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to address no contact order on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Report filed in error.  Report submitted on wrong case.

Court ordered no contact with IMR (03/17/2014), FOE (01/03/2012), and CAL (11/30/2012)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mary E Jackson- Towers in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Mary E Jackson- Towers in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mary E Jackson- Towers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
